intro: Oldenlandia cana, commonly known as the slender knotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often sprawling stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Oldenlandia cana is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides, fields, and along stream banks.
